Magnetic Anomaly Maps¶

The following are key functions related to magnetic anomaly maps.

Load Map Data¶

magnavpy.map_utils.get_map(map_name: str, *args, **kwargs) → MapS | MapV | None[source]¶

Placeholder for get_map. Retrieves a specific magnetic map. Actual implementation would load from file or database.

Built-in map data¶

magnavpy.map_utils.ottawa_area_maps(map_name: str = '', *args, **kwargs) → MapS | None[source]¶

Placeholder for ottawa_area_maps.

magnavpy.map_utils.namad(*args, **kwargs) → MapS | None[source]¶

Placeholder for namad map loader.

magnavpy.map_utils.emag2(*args, **kwargs) → MapS | None[source]¶

Placeholder for emag2 map loader.

magnavpy.map_utils.emm720(*args, **kwargs) → MapS | None[source]¶

Placeholder for emm720 map loader.

Upward Continue Map¶

magnavpy.map_utils.upward_fft(map_in: MapS, alt_out: float, *args, **kwargs) → MapS[source]¶

Placeholder for upward_fft continuation.

Interpolate Map¶

magnavpy.map_utils.map_interpolate(map_obj: MapS, lat: ndarray, lon: ndarray, *args, **kwargs) → ndarray[source]¶

Placeholder for map_interpolate. This is largely superseded by get_map_val.

Plot Map¶

magnavpy.plot_functions.plot_mag(xyz, ind=None, detrend_data=False, use_mags=None, vec_terms=None, ylim=None, dpi=None, show_plot=True, save_plot=False, plot_png='scalar_mags.png')[source]¶

Plot scalar or vector (fluxgate) magnetometer data. xyz: An object expected to have attributes like xyz.traj.tt, xyz.mag_1_c, and for vector mags, attributes like xyz.flux_a which itself has .x, .y, .z, .t.
